txt.en: Comfort Niriga as best you can.
'Quickly. My husband may be wounded or bound as we speak. We must go!'
Search Urmâkh for Namâkh's personal effects for clues as to Namâkh's location.
Speak with Niriga when you are ready to go.
Search Urmâkh for Namâkh's personal effects ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Return to Niriga with the items and report the location you found them.
Found one of Namâkh's personal effects ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'Where did you say they were? That house all the items were around is abandoned... or at least it was. Quickly, we must go there! I believe Namâkh was there. And I am coming with you. I will do anything I can to help my husband.'
Niriga is worried her husband has been kidnapped by Barûl, the dog-catcher. Search for clues as to Namâkh's whereabouts.

'We must do everything we can to find Namâkh! I know he would have left me clues. I believe he and Barûl may still be in Urmâkh. We need to search Urmâkh for anything that could have been on my husband - anything he left behind for us.'
Speak with Niriga when you are ready to go

'He's gone. I can't believe he's gone. And that... thing. I don't know what it was - it called itself The Hungry Storm? I thought it was just a legend? It was so awful. So awful.

'I can't believe he's gone.

'I can't believe he's gone.'
